item.title: Oil Pastel Exploration: 1/3/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demystifies working with oil pastels and teaches some cool techniques along the way. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 3, 2017.

item.title: Creative Boot Camp - Six Exercises to Spark Artistic Discovery
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description:
Jumpstart your artistic practice with six weeks of creativity exercises taught by Lisa Congdon. Using a variety of Lisa's favorite art supplies and tried-and-true processes, learn how to use Microns, oil sticks, paints and collage to take a fresh look at shape, line and color. These exercises allow you to "get loose" and enjoy the process without overthinking the outcome. You’ll also learn how to work with color, use collage to respond to your in-progress artwork, and go outside to gather inspiration from your surroundings. Unlike Lisa's other classes, this series focuses less on specific projects and dives deeply into the artistic process to help you develop your own creative voice.

Make sure to share your artwork in our class galleries and on Instagram #cbugbootcamp

item.title: Q&A With Dawn DeVries Sokol: 12/15/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Join Courtney for a Q&A with Dawn DeVries Sokol as she introduces her Holiday Art Journaling class. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 15, 2016.

item.title: Illustrative Painting with Gouache
item.author: Jennifer Orkin Lewis
item.description: Learn how Jennifer Orkin Lewis (also known as August Wren) uses gouache to create vibrant illustrations. Jennifer’s paintings are full of color and movement, and in this 3-part series, you’ll learn how to approach painting in her lively style. The class begins with a lesson on mixing colors and painting everyday objects. Once you’ve had a chance to practice your brushstrokes, you’ll learn how to paint florals and create stylized lettering.

item.title: Illustrative Painting with Gouache
item.author: Jennifer Orkin Lewis
item.description: Learn how Jennifer Orkin Lewis (also known as August Wren) uses gouache to create vibrant illustrations. Jennifer’s paintings are full of color and movement, and in this 3-part series, you’ll learn how to approach painting in her lively style. The class begins with a lesson on mixing colors and painting everyday objects. Once you’ve had a chance to practice your brushstrokes, you’ll learn how to paint florals and create stylized lettering.

The class begins with a lesson on mixing colors and painting everyday objects. Once you’ve had a chance to practice your brushstrokes, you’ll learn how to paint florals and create stylized lettering.

item.title: Daily Creativity Challenge
item.author: Creativebug
item.description: The team at Creativebug is surrounded by inspiration every day, but even the most prolific amongst us needs a jumpstart now and then. We asked members of our staff to share their go-to tips for finding creativity when the well has run dry. Their answers are as versatile as the artists themselves. Each day this month, members of our staff will be sharing their favorite ways to stoke the creative fires. Join us for a month of painting, drawing, journaling, organizing, upcycling, beautifying, and so much more.

item.title: Drawing and Chatting with Lisa Congdon: 9/29/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Lisa Congdon and Courtney Cerruti doodle, talk art, drink tea, and answer questions. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on September 29, 2016.

item.title: Doodling on an iPad
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: When it comes to doodling, paper and pen aren’t your only options. Pam Garrison demonstrates how she likes to use her iPad to doodle using the free app “Paper” by FiftyThree and talks about how it inspires her process. You really don’t have to be a tech expert to use technology for your creations.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 31 Art Journal Prompts with Dawn DeVries Sokol
item.author: Dawn DeVries Sokol
item.description: Join professional doodler, Dawn DeVries Sokol, for a month of art journaling inspiration. Every day for 31 days, Dawn provides prompts to get you making art that is fun, intuitive and totally you. Learn how to create backgrounds, respond to prompts, and add embellishments, lettering and collage along the way. Stay loose and respond to whatever strikes you in the moment without the pressure of having to create a “finished” piece of art.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 31 Pattern Motifs with Courtney Cerruti
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Go beyond drawing individual objects with our daily pattern motif drawing challenge. In this 31-part class, Courtney Cerruti shares easy ideas for approaching surface design, opening new avenues of imagination and creativity. To keep things simple, Courtney works exclusively on index cards using brush markers. From foods to animals to abstract geometric shapes, you’ll explore fun, loose variations on a different pattern motif every day for a month. When you’re all done, the index cards are the perfect size to mail to friends (or us!).

item.title: Creative Doodling
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: Stretch your creative muscles and join Pam Garrison in this fun four-part celebration of doodling. In Pam’s classes, mistakes are embraced and you are encouraged to think outside of the box as you play with your designs and develop an expanded visual vocabulary. The great thing about doodling is that anyone can do it, nearly anywhere! If you already doodle while on the phone, in meetings or in the margins of your notebook, Pam’s class will help you take your creative doodling practice even further.

item.title: Creative Doodling

item.description: Stretch your creative muscles and join Pam Garrison in this fun four-part celebration of doodling. The great thing about doodling is that anyone can do it, nearly anywhere! If you already doodle while on the phone, in meetings or in the margins of your notebook, Pam’s class will help you take your creative doodling practice even further.

item.title: Daily Painting Challenge: 30 Things to Paint with August Wren
item.author: Jennifer Orkin Lewis
item.description: In this 30-day painting challenge, Jennifer Orkin Lewis (known as @Augustwren on Instagram) draws inspiration from objects found in real life and imagination. Using gouache and watercolor, she demonstrates her approach to painting without fear and reminds us that it’s never too late to start painting. Jennifer started her daily painting practice three years ago, painting for just thirty minutes every day. In that time, she has cultivated the loose, colorful style that she’s known for, inspiring thousands of people along the way.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: Tracing Shadows with Lisa Solomon
item.author: Lisa Solomon
item.description: For this month-long daily drawing challenge, we’ve added a twist. Artist and educator Lisa Solomon shows how to use overhead light and everyday objects to cast interesting shadows onto paper, then draw around the shadows to create outlines. What you do within the outlines is where the real fun begins. Each day, Lisa shares a new idea filling outlined shapes with color and texture, using everything from pens and graphite to watercolors and highlighters. This technique is a great way to experiment with composition and keep your drawing practice loose. Simply start with a shadow and allow yourself to play within the lines.

item.title: Color Wheel Basics: Working with Paints and Colored Pencils
item.author: Molly Hatch
item.description: Learn how to mix and manage colors in this artistic primer course. Illustrator Molly Hatch explains how the color wheel works, showing how to mix secondary and tertiary colors using primary colors, and how to mix tints and shades. Finally, she demonstrates how to create a personalized palette for your artwork with a fun coloring book page exercise (PDF included with class).

item.title: Charcoal Blending Tools
item.author: Lisa Solomon
item.description: Learn how to create velvety lines and ghost-like shading with charcoal and blending tools. Lisa Solomon demonstrates the qualities of compressed black and white charcoal and charcoal pencils using blending stumps, a kneaded eraser and a chamois. At the end, you’ll learn how to use them all together to create volume and depth.

item.title: Drawing Essentials: Composition and Perspective
item.author: Molly Hatch
item.description: Take your line drawings to the next level with this course on composition and perspective. Illustrator Molly Hatch teaches basic rules for adding depth to your drawings and crafting great compositions, including the Rule of Thirds and the Rule of Odds. Molly also shares several helpful exercises for creating rhythm and balance, plus a primer on adding perspective to your artwork. When used together, all of these essential drawing techniques will help you create a balanced, interesting composition.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 31 Things to Draw with Pam Garrison
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: Jumpstart your creative practice with a 31-day drawing challenge, taught by artist and professional doodler Pam Garrison. In this draw-along, Pam shares her playful, encouraging style, providing prompts and colorful demonstrations every single day for a month. Not only will you learn how to draw ordinary objects and add splashes of color, but you’ll also learn how to strengthen your creative muscles and develop a new habit. You’ll be amazed at how much your skills will grow in just one month. Be sure to post your drawings on Instagram using #cbdrawaday

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 29 Things to Draw with Molly Hatch and Heather Ross
item.author: Molly Hatch and Heather Ross
item.description:
Because the January Daily Drawing Challenge with Lisa Congdon was such a rousing success, we thought, hey, why not fan the flames of creativity and host a drawing challenge for February? And so, due to popular demand, we are thrilled to present our February Daily Drawing Challenge. For 29 days, we will release bite-sized drawing classes taken from the Creativebug archives. Taught by expert drawing instructors Molly Hatch and Heather Ross, you'll learn classic techniques for rendering everyday objects as well as opportunities to practice your blind contour skills.

For this challenge, we will be giving away a HUGE PRIZE to the winning participant: A trip to San Francisco to visit the Creativebug Studios! Click here to find out all of the juicy contest details, and be sure to share what you draw on Instagram #cbdrawaday. After all, when we see creative mojo happening, it is our responsibility to keep the party going. 

To see the full classes from which our Daily February Challenge originated, check out Heather Ross's Drawing and Illustration course and Molly Hatch's Introduction to Drawing course--both are a great place for beginners to start and offer excellent guidance.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 31 Things to Draw with Lisa Congdon
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: There’s nothing like starting off the new year with a big creative challenge, and boy do we have one for you: Every single day for the month of January, we challenge you to draw along with Lisa Congdon. Lisa has hand-picked 31 objects to draw, and demonstrates several ways to render each object using just your imagination. This creative exercise is designed to help you embrace wonkiness and imperfections, all while learning to see everything around you—be it bird or bikini—as artistic fodder.

item.title: Top 12 Classes of 2015
item.author: Creativebug
item.description:
Want to know which classes topped the charts in 2015? Watch this quick video to get a glimpse of our 12 most popular classes of the year.

Thank you, teachers, for sharing your knowledge. And thank you, students, for showing up to class. What an amazing year we've had together.

1) Sketchbook Explorations with Lisa Congdon
2) Intermediate Watercolor with Yao Cheng
3) How to Design Fabric with Denyse Schmidt, Heather Ross and Lizzy House
4) Embroidery Sampler with Rebecca Ringquist
5) Creative Sketchbooking with Pam Garrison
6) Sew a Sailor Top with Fancy Tiger Crafts
7) Drawing and Illustration Basics with Heather Ross
8) Beginning Calligraphy with Maybelle Imasa-Stukuls
9) Introduction to Drawing with Molly Hatch
10) Image Transfers with Courtney Cerruti
11) Trace a T-Shirt, Make a Wardrobe with Improv Sewing
12) Art Journaling with Dawn DeVries Sokol

item.title: How to Cut a Mat and Frame Your Artwork
item.author: Hilary Williams
item.description: Having your artwork and photos professionally framed can be pricey—especially if you have several pieces to frame. In this class, Hilary Williams shows how to professionally mat and frame your artwork at home for a fraction of the price. You will learn how to mount and back artwork of any size and add a dust cover to finish it off. Whether you’re an artist with a collection of pieces that need to be framed, or you simply want to frame your favorite family photos, this class will show you exactly how simple it is to get a professional look at home.

item.title: More Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: Are you ready to dive back into your sketchbook? Lisa Congdon is back with even more mixed media exercises to explore within the pages of your sketchbook. Using an assortment of colorful mediums, Lisa guides you through the process of developing your own personal voice and style in this four-part course. You will learn the basics of creating well-balanced backgrounds as well as lessons on adding dimension with flowers, animal figures and abstract designs.

item.title: More Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: Are you ready to dive back into your sketchbook? Lisa Congdon is back with even more mixed media exercises to explore within the pages of your sketchbook. Using an assortment of colorful mediums, Lisa guides you through the process of developing your own personal voice and style in this four-part course. You will learn the basics of creating well-balanced backgrounds as well as lessons on adding dimension with flowers, animal figures and abstract designs.

You will learn the basics of creating well-balanced backgrounds as well as lessons on adding dimension with flowers, animal figures and abstract designs.

item.title: More Sketchbook Explorations
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description: Are you ready to dive back into your sketchbook? Lisa Congdon is back with even more mixed media exercises to explore within the pages of your sketchbook. Using an assortment of colorful mediums, Lisa guides you through the process of developing your own personal voice and style in this four-part course. You will learn the basics of creating well-balanced backgrounds as well as lessons on adding dimension with flowers, animal figures and abstract designs.

item.title: Creative Sketchbooking
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: Learn how to develop a unique, intuitive artistic style with Pam Garrison. In this four-part journey, Pam shares her approach to using "action and reaction" to create artwork in a sketchbook. Learn how to draw and doodle using your dominant and non-dominant hands and create backgrounds with collage and abstract brush strokes. You will continue to build on your backgrounds throughout the course, allowing each action to be inspired by your last. This class is truly an inspiration for anyone who feels they lack creativity, as Pam encourages everyone to find the artist within.

item.title: Creative Sketchbooking

item.title: Watercolor Silhouette
item.author: Christine Schmidt
item.description: This project appeals to a range of personalities, since you can be loose with creating the watercolor effect and then add structure with a crisp silhouette. Christine shows you different watercolor techniques to build texture and dimension, from layered washes to dry brushing and splattering. The result is a fresh update on the classically Victorian way to capture the likeness of someone you adore.

item.title: Found Image Painting
item.author: Molly Hatch
item.description: Feeling artistic but intimidated because you dont think you can draw? Molly shares her process of creating a piece of art based on found imagery. She covers where to source material as well as how to group and gather elements into a painting. The final image is translated through your own hand with all the artistic charm and none of the self-doubt that too often creeps into creating art.
